examples: Rivalries and prejudice were by degrees fading out.
In her entire career, Monia has stayed a cut above the rest by steering clear of prejudices and letting her work talk for itself.
As a journalist, I believe that fair play is a jewel, and it's important to report the truth without bias or prejudice.
Prejudice is a poison that divides and conquers the people that are engaged in this fear based, antagonistic way of living.
The racial slur in this newsreel title shows the prejudice towards Mexican workers during this time.
words.defineEn: an unreasonable opinion or judgment based on dislike felt for a person, group, etc., particularly because of their race, sex, etc.
words.defineVi: một ý kiến hoặc đánh giá vô lý dựa trên cảm giác không thích đối với một người, một nhóm, v.v., đặc biệt là vì chủng tộc, giới tính của họ, v.v.

examples: Can you recommend a reliable bank for opening a new account?
It's a reliable car, and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg.
We should search for a reliable source to verify the information.
I use the newspaper as a source for my research papers because it has reliable information.
The car was old but reliable, and he reminded himself that better a good cow than a cow of a good kind when he was tempted to buy a flashy, expensive new car.
words.defineEn: based on sound reasoning or evidence and can be trusted to be accurate
words.defineVi: dựa trên lý luận hoặc bằng chứng hợp lý và có thể được tin cậy là chính xác

words.defineEn: a belief or explanation that suggests a secret group or organization is responsible for an event, often involving illegal or dishonest activities
words.defineVi: một niềm tin hoặc lời giải thích cho thấy một nhóm hoặc tổ chức bí mật chịu trách nhiệm cho một sự kiện, thường liên quan đến các hoạt động bất hợp pháp hoặc không trung thực

examples: Pier One is often saddled with lousy locations.
I'm not spending four cents for your lousy property.
Party City said an industry wide dip in sales contributed to its lousy October sales numbers.
Because your parents always made you a giant ice cream sundae on days when you were feeling lousy?
Down here, you'll start to feel pretty lousy, because the sun's gravity is so strong, a 150-pound person on Earth would weigh about 4,000 pounds here.
words.defineEn: describing something that is perceived as being of very low quality, unpleasant, or objectionable
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó được coi là có chất lượng rất thấp, khó chịu hoặc phản cảm

examples: Our dream destination for this year's vacation is a secluded tropical island.
The market vendor displayed a variety of tropical fruits, each with its own unique-colored mesocarp.
Drizzling key lime syrup over pancakes or waffles gives them a delicious tropical twist.
I discovered the delightful combination of pawpaw and coconut in a tropical fruit salad.
The agar cubes added a delightful chewiness to the tropical fruit salad.
words.defineEn: situated in or from the hottest parts of the world at the sides of the equator
words.defineVi: nằm trong hoặc từ các khu vực nóng nhất trên thế giới ở hai bên đường xích đạo

examples: She said an awful lot
The incident says an awful lot about his character.
It's awful having a boss who breathes down your neck all the time.
I told you that you'd feel awful if you drank that much wine.
He couldn't help but grimace when he saw the awful outfit his friend was wearing.
words.defineEn: extremely unpleasant, bad, or disagreeable
words.defineVi: cực kỳ khó chịu, xấu, hoặc khó chịu

examples: Grandma's crab apple sauce is really delicious.
I offered my guests delicious beetroot burgers as a flavorful vegetarian option.
The cranberry pie at the bakery is absolutely delicious, especially with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Fresh vegetables like tomatoes, cucumbers, and lettuce make a delicious salad.
It's just too delicious!
words.defineEn: having a good taste
words.defineVi: có một hương vị tốt

examples: Small cracks appeared in the wall.
That holiday cost me a small fortune.
This small restaurant is the best pound for pound in the city.
The whole may be smaller than the sum of its parts!
I gave a small donation.
words.defineEn: little or below average in size, amount, degree, etc.
words.defineVi: ít hoặc dưới mức trung bình về kích thước, số lượng, mức độ, v.v.

examples: The movie was as boring as they come.
It’s so boring, eating the same food day in, day out.
I have to do the same boring jobs day in day out.
The child nodded off to sleep during the boring lecture.
This course seemed right up my alley when I signed up for it, but it ended up being dreadfully boring.
words.defineEn: making us feel tired and unsatisfied because of not being interesting
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy mệt mỏi và không hài lòng vì không thú vị

examples: They get stale.
For example, selling stale Doritos.
Sucking out the stale blood to make way for the good stuff.
Ah, contrary to popular belief, things don't get stale because they lose water.
The Crumbler grinds stale baguettes into breadcrumbs that are so fine they can replace flour.
words.defineEn: (of food, particularly cake and bread) not fresh anymore
words.defineVi: (thức ăn, đặc biệt là bánh và bánh mì) không còn tươi nữa

examples: I hate a pen that's stingy with ink and boy that Pilot pen was so stingy with ink.
I hate a pen that's stingy with ink and boy that Pilot pen was so stingy with ink.
That’s all fine if your ultimate position in life is to sit on the ocean floor or drift along like a squishy blob of stingy spaghetti.
You've got ta love people like George, he's mastered this art for himself and even though there's money in it, he still not stingy with the knowledge that he's gained.
words.defineEn: unwilling to spend or give away money or resources
words.defineVi: không muốn chi tiêu hoặc cho đi tiền hoặc tài nguyên

words.defineEn: used to ask for an explanation or reason for something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để yêu cầu một lời giải thích hoặc lý do cho một cái gì đó

examples: My friend prefers a vegetarian sandwich with avocado and sprouts.
My vegetarian friend often uses beans as a filling for vegetarian tacos.
My vegetarian friend enjoyed a nourishing adzuki bean grain bowl for lunch.
The vegetarian menu offers a delicious black bean burrito as a protein-packed option.
The restaurant offered a vegetarian dish with a mix of seasonal vegetables.
words.defineEn: someone who avoids eating meat or fish
words.defineVi: một người tránh ăn thịt hoặc cá

examples: As a vegan, she substituted almond butter for traditional dairy-based spreads.
Some vegan cheeses use algae-based ingredients to achieve a creamy texture and unique flavor.
As a vegan, she often used tahini as a substitute for butter or cream in her recipes.
As a vegan alternative, they used graham flour to create a plant-based pie crust.
I tried a vegan cookie made with plant-based ingredients and loved its taste.
words.defineEn: someone who does not consume or use anything that is produced from animals, such as meat, milk, or eggs
words.defineVi: một người không tiêu thụ hoặc sử dụng bất cứ thứ gì được sản xuất từ động vật, chẳng hạn như thịt, sữa hoặc trứng

examples: Come bedtime, insomniacs are stressed.
Meanwhile Macbeth is an insomniac.
This symptom of poor sleep leaves insomniacs waking in a state of exhaustion, confusion, and stress, which starts the process all over again.
And when insomniacs finally do fall asleep, the quality of their rest is compromised.
But PET studies show the adrenaline that prevents sleep for insomniacs also speeds up their metabolisms.
words.defineEn: someone who has persistent difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, or getting quality sleep
words.defineVi: người liên tục khó ngủ, ngủ không sâu giấc hoặc ngủ không ngon giấc

words.defineEn: someone who completely avoids alcohol consumption due to personal choice, religion, or other reasons
words.defineVi: một người hoàn toàn tránh uống rượu do sự lựa chọn cá nhân, tôn giáo, hoặc các lý do khác

examples: You're a pacifist?
Her parents were Sufi pacifists, who put their faith in the power of music and compassion.
Constructing Lenin as some kind of idealistic pacifist just goes against historical facts.
Quakers had to resort to such tricks because they were pacifists.
As pacifists, they believed that all disputes should be settled non-violently.
words.defineEn: someone who advocates for peaceful methods to resolve conflicts and opposes violence or war as a means of achieving goals
words.defineVi: một người ủng hộ các phương pháp hòa bình để giải quyết xung đột và phản đối bạo lực hoặc chiến tranh như một phương tiện để đạt được mục tiêu

examples: Both the Church report and the atheist professor are spitting into the wind, of course, because the incoming tide of superstition has a long way to rise yet.
Plenty of existentialists are atheists, but some are theists, like Kierkegaard.
I'm an atheist, but pray for me, man.
Raised Catholic, Anne Rice became an atheist at the age of 18.
Some philosophers are theists, and others are atheists.
words.defineEn: someone who does not believe in the existence of God or gods
words.defineVi: một người không tin vào sự tồn tại của Thiên Chúa hoặc các vị thần

examples: You don’t dare get into any kind of discussion or you might look like a racist or a homophobe or a bigot or a xenophobe.
words.defineEn: someone who has an irrational fear, aversion, or hostility towards people or things perceived as foreign or different, often resulting in prejudice or discrimination
words.defineVi: một người có một nỗi sợ hãi, ác cảm hoặc thù địch phi lý đối với những người hoặc những thứ được coi là xa lạ hoặc khác biệt, thường dẫn đến định kiến hoặc phân biệt đối xử

words.defineEn: someone who opposes or rejects the institution of monarchy, often advocating for its abolition
words.defineVi: một người phản đối hoặc bác bỏ thể chế quân chủ, thường ủng hộ việc bãi bỏ nó

words.defineEn: someone who is resistant or apprehensive towards technology, often avoiding or expressing fear or aversion towards its use or adoption
words.defineVi: một người phản đối hoặc e ngại đối với công nghệ, thường tránh hoặc bày tỏ sự sợ hãi hoặc ác cảm đối với việc sử dụng hoặc áp dụng nó

examples: The politician's off-the-cuff remark about pollution stirred up a hornet's nest among environmentalists.
Environmentalists claimed governments were fiddling while Rome burned.
He was an environmentalist.
Environmentalists argue in practice the plastic mailers aren't better for the environment.
But many environmentalists say we need a better solution.
words.defineEn: a person who is concerned with the environment and tries to protect it
words.defineVi: một người quan tâm đến môi trường và cố gắng bảo vệ nó

examples: He's such a hypocrite!
You're being a hypocrite.
Others call rich countries hypocrites that got rich by polluting without restraint and now expect others not to industrialize and stay poor.
Then that's when his entire group of friends act like hypocrites and then they start to go against him.
Putin certainly thought that this came as Bush’s order, and that Bush was a hypocrite.
words.defineEn: someone who pretends to have virtues or beliefs they do not practice, often contradicting their own stated values or engaging in deceptive behavior
words.defineVi: ai đó giả vờ có đức tính hoặc niềm tin mà họ không thực hành, thường mâu thuẫn với các giá trị đã nêu của chính họ hoặc tham gia vào hành vi lừa đảo
